title: B2 Grammar - General Review 2
subject: english
description: Upper-intermediate review covering Passive Voice, Reported Speech, Causatives, and Advanced Structures.

questions.text: The criminal is believed _____ the country last week.
questions.explanation: Passive with reporting verbs: Use the perfect infinitive ('to have left') when the reported action is in the past.

questions.text: I need to get my car _____ before the trip.
questions.explanation: Causative form (get something done): 'get' + object + past participle implies arranging for someone else to do it.

questions.text: She asked me where _____.
questions.explanation: Indirect questions (Reported Speech) follow standard statement word order (Subject + Verb), not question order.

questions.text: _____ the rain, we enjoyed the concert.
questions.explanation: 'Despite' is a preposition and is followed by a noun or gerund, unlike 'Although' which needs a clause.

questions.text: I'd rather you _____ smoke inside the house.
questions.explanation: 'I'd rather' + person + past tense is used to express a preference for someone's actions.

questions.text: Never _____ such a beautiful sunset.
questions.explanation: Inversion is used after negative adverbs like 'Never' for emphasis.

questions.text: He suggested _____ to the cinema.
questions.explanation: The verb 'suggest' is followed by a gerund (-ing) or a 'that' clause, never an infinitive.

questions.text: The man _____ car was stolen is at the police station.
questions.explanation: 'Whose' is the relative pronoun used to indicate possession.

questions.text: I can't put _____ with this noise anymore!
questions.explanation: Phrasal verb 'put up with' means to tolerate or endure.

questions.text: It was _____ a boring film that I fell asleep.
questions.explanation: Use 'such' before a noun phrase ('a boring film'). Use 'so' before an adjective alone ('so boring').

questions.text: Unless you _____ harder, you won't pass the exam.
questions.explanation: In 'unless' clauses referring to the future, we use the Present Simple.

questions.text: He stopped _____ a newspaper on his way home.
questions.explanation: 'Stop to buy' means stopping an action in order to do something else (infinitive of purpose).

questions.text: It is essential that he _____ informed immediately.
questions.explanation: The Subjunctive mood uses the base form ('be') after adjectives of necessity like 'essential'.

questions.text: Had I known about the party, I _____ gone.
questions.explanation: Inversion in Third Conditional: 'Had I known' is equivalent to 'If I had known'.

questions.text: She accused him _____ lying to her.
questions.explanation: The verb 'accuse' takes the preposition 'of' (accuse someone of doing something).

questions.text: There's no point _____ to convince him.
questions.explanation: 'There's no point in' is followed by a gerund.

questions.text: I'll take an umbrella in case it _____.
questions.explanation: 'In case' is followed by the Present Simple when referring to the future.

questions.text: The more you practice, _____ you will become.
questions.explanation: Double comparative structure: 'The more..., the better...'.

questions.text: She _____ have taken the keys; they aren't on the table.
questions.explanation: Modals of deduction: 'Must have' expresses a logical conclusion about a past event.

questions.text: _____ being exhausted, he finished the marathon.
questions.explanation: 'Despite' is followed by a gerund phrase ('being exhausted') or a noun.
